summary: Wimbledon is the world's oldest and most prestigious tennis tournament, held annually in London. It's one of the four Grand Slam events, taking place in late June and early July. The tournament began in 1877 and is played on grass courts, which is unique among major tournaments. Wimbledon has traditions like an all-white dress code and serving strawberries and cream. The event lasts two weeks, with the final matches on the last weekend. In recent years, they added retractable roofs to the main courts to handle rain. Wimbledon was canceled in 2020 due to the pandemic but has since resumed.
title: Wimbledon Championships
